info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 5:31PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Graham and southern Greenlee Counties through 630 PM MST... At 530 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southeast of Solomon, or 19 miles southeast of Safford, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly remote areas of southeastern Graham and southern Greenlee Counties. This includes the following highways... Route 70 between mile markers 351 and 373. Route 191 between mile markers 132 and 136. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
